1. Inquiry.speaker: Customer
1. Inquiry.korean: 안녕하세요. 여기 1100고지 산책로 까지는 얼마나 걸려요?
1. Inquiry.tts: 안녕하세요. 여기 1100고지 산책로 까지는 얼마나 걸려요?
1. Inquiry.roman: an-nyeong-ha-se-yo. yeo-gi 1100go-ji san-chaeng-no kka-ji-neun eol-ma-na geol-lyeo-yo?
1. Inquiry.english: Hello. How long does it take to get to the 1100m high mountain trail?

1. Inquiry.speaker: Staff
1. Inquiry.korean: 보통 왕복 30~40분 정도 걸려요. 길이 잘 되어 있어서 어렵지 않아요.
1. Inquiry.tts: 보통 왕복 30~40분 정도 걸려요. 길이 잘 되어 있어서 어렵지 않아요.
1. Inquiry.roman: bo-tong wang-bok 30~40bun jeong-do geol-lyeo-yo. gi-ri jal doe-eo i-sseo-seo eo-ryeop-jji a-na-yo.
1. Inquiry.english: It usually takes about 30 to 40 minutes round trip. The road is well-maintained, so it's not difficult.

1. Inquiry.speaker: Customer
1. Inquiry.korean: 아, 그래요? 눈이 와도 괜찮을까요?
1. Inquiry.tts: 아, 그래요? 눈이 와도 괜찮을까요?
1. Inquiry.roman: a, geu-rae-yo? nu-ni wa-do gwaen-cha-neul-kka-yo?
1. Inquiry.english: Oh, really? Is it okay even if it snows?

1. Inquiry.speaker: Staff
1. Inquiry.korean: 네, 다만 조금 미끄러운 구간이 있으니, 조심해서 걸으시면 돼요.
1. Inquiry.tts: 네, 다만 조금 미끄러운 구간이 있으니, 조심해서 걸으시면 돼요.
1. Inquiry.roman: ne, da-man jo-geum mi-kkeu-reo-un gu-ga-ni i-sseu-ni, jo-sim-hae-seo geo-reu-si-myeon dwae-yo.
1. Inquiry.english: Yes, but there are some slightly slippery sections, so please be careful when walking.

1. Inquiry.speaker: Customer
1. Inquiry.korean: 네, 감사합니다.
1. Inquiry.tts: 네, 감사합니다.
1. Inquiry.roman: ne, gam-sa-ham-ni-da.
1. Inquiry.english: Thank you.

2-1. Transportation.speaker: Customer
2-1. Transportation.korean: 실례합니다. 여기서 시내로 가는 버스는 어디서 타나요?
2-1. Transportation.tts: 실례합니다. 여기서 시내로 가는 버스는 어디서 타나요?
2-1. Transportation.roman: sil-lye-ham-ni-da. yeo-gi-seo si-nae-ro ga-neun beo-seu-neun eo-di-seo ta-na-yo?
2-1. Transportation.english: Excuse me. Where can I catch the bus to downtown from here?

2-1. Transportation.speaker: Staff
2-1. Transportation.korean: 건물 앞쪽 도로에서 시외버스가 정차합니다. 가시면 표지판이 있어요.
2-1. Transportation.tts: 건물 앞쪽 도로에서 시외버스가 정차합니다. 가시면 표지판이 있어요.
2-1. Transportation.roman: geon-mul ap-jjok do-ro-e-seo si-oe-beo-seu-ga jeong-cha-ham-ni-da. ga-si-myeon pyo-ji-pa-ni i-sseo-yo.
2-1. Transportation.english: The intercity bus stops on the road in front of the building. There's a sign there.

2-1. Transportation.speaker: Customer
2-1. Transportation.english: Can you call a taxi too?

2-1. Transportation.speaker: Staff
2-1. Transportation.korean: 네, 호출앱으로 부르면 올 수 있지만, 시간이 조금 걸릴 수도 있어요.
2-1. Transportation.tts: 네, 호출앱으로 부르면 올 수 있지만, 시간이 조금 걸릴 수도 있어요.
2-1. Transportation.roman: ne, ho-chu-rae-beu-ro bu-reu-myeon ol su it-jji-man, si-ga-ni jo-geum geol-lil su-do i-sseo-yo.
2-1. Transportation.english: Yes, you can call them using the ride-hailing app, but it may take some time.

2-2. Transportation.speaker: Customer
2-2. Transportation.korean: 안녕하세요. 여기서 바로 한라산 정상까지 갈 수 있어요?
2-2. Transportation.tts: 안녕하세요. 여기서 바로 한라산 정상까지 갈 수 있어요?
2-2. Transportation.roman: an-nyeong-ha-se-yo. yeo-gi-seo ba-ro hal-la-san jeong-sang-kka-ji gal su i-sseo-yo?
2-2. Transportation.english: Hello. Can I get to the top of Hallasan Mountain directly from here?

2-2. Transportation.speaker: Staff
2-2. Transportation.korean: 아, 아닙니다. 1100고지는 전맹대이고, 정상까지 직접 연결된 등산로는 없어요.
2-2. Transportation.tts: 아, 아닙니다. 1100고지는 전맹대이고, 정상까지 직접 연결된 등산로는 없어요.
2-2. Transportation.roman: a, a-nim-ni-da. 1100go-ji-neun jeon-maeng-dae-i-go, jeong-sang-kka-ji jik-jjeop yeon-gyeol-doen deung-sal-lo-neun eop-seo-yo.
2-2. Transportation.english: Oh, no. Hill 1100 is an observation deck, and there's no direct trail to the summit.

2-2. Transportation.speaker: Customer
2-2. Transportation.korean: 아, 그런가요? 저는 바로 갈 수 있는 줄 알았어요.
2-2. Transportation.tts: 아, 그런가요? 저는 바로 갈 수 있는 줄 알았어요.
2-2. Transportation.roman: a, geu-reon-ga-yo? jeo-neun ba-ro gal su in-neun jul a-ra-sseo-yo.
2-2. Transportation.english: Oh, really? I thought I could go right away.

2-2. Transportation.speaker: Staff
2-2. Transportation.korean: 정상등반은 성판악이나 관음사 코스로 이동하셔야 해요.
2-2. Transportation.tts: 정상등반은 성판악이나 관음사 코스로 이동하셔야 해요.
2-2. Transportation.roman: jeong-sang-deung-ba-neun seong-pa-na-gi-na gwa-neum-sa ko-seu-ro i-dong-ha-syeo-ya hae-yo.
2-2. Transportation.english: To reach the summit, you must take the Seongpanak or Gwaneumsa courses.

2-2. Transportation.speaker: Customer
2-2. Transportation.english: How do I get to Seonpanak?

2-2. Transportation.speaker: Staff
2-2. Transportation.english: You can get there by taking an intercity bus.

3. Climbing.speaker: Customer
3. Climbing.english: Hello. How far is it to the top?

3. Climbing.speaker: Staff
3. Climbing.english: Ah, we're almost there! Cheer up.

3. Climbing.speaker: Customer
3. Climbing.english: Oh, really? How many minutes will it take?

3. Climbing.speaker: Staff
3. Climbing.korean: 아니예요. 금방이예요. 친구분이랑 얘기하면서 가다보면 어느 새 도착해 있을 거예요.
3. Climbing.tts: 아니예요. 금방이예요. 친구분이랑 얘기하면서 가다보면 어느 새 도착해 있을 거예요.
3. Climbing.roman: a-ni-ye-yo. geum-bang-i-ye-yo. chin-gu-bu-ni-rang yae-gi-ha-myeon-seo ga-da-bo-myeon eo-neu sae do-cha-kae i-sseul geo-ye-yo.
3. Climbing.english: No, it'll be quick. If you keep talking with your friend, you'll arrive before you know it.

3. Photo.speaker: Customer
3. Photo.english: Where is a good place to take pictures?

3. Photo.speaker: Staff
3. Photo.korean: 산책로 중간에 목재 데크 전망대가 있어요. 경치 괜찮아요.

3. Photo.english: There's a wooden deck observation deck in the middle of the trail. The view is great.

3. Photo.speaker: Customer
3. Photo.korean: 아, 그럼 거기까지 가려면 얼마나 걸려요?
3. Photo.tts: 아, 그럼 거기까지 가려면 얼마나 걸려요?
3. Photo.roman: a, geu-reom geo-gi-kka-ji ga-ryeo-myeon eol-ma-na geol-lyeo-yo?
3. Photo.english: Oh, so how long does it take to get there?

3. Photo.speaker: Staff
3. Photo.english: It takes about 10 minutes one way.

3. Photo.speaker: Customer
3. Photo.korean: 사진 좀 찍어 주실 수 있나요?

3. Photo.english: Could you please take a picture for me?

3. Photo.speaker: Staff
3. Photo.english: Yes, I'll take a picture for you.

3. Photo.speaker: Customer
3. Photo.english: Please show me the wetlands behind me.

3. Photo.speaker: Staff
3. Photo.english: Yes, I understand. One, two, three!

4. Yahoo.speaker: Customer
4. Yahoo.english: Wow, the view is really nice. "Ya~ho~"

4. Yahoo.speaker: Staff
4. Yahoo.korean: 어, 죄송한데 여기선 야호하면 안돼요. 동물들이 놀라요.
4. Yahoo.tts: 어, 죄송한데 여기선 야호하면 안돼요. 동물들이 놀라요.

4. Yahoo.english: Oh, I'm sorry, but please don't shout here. It'll startle the animals.

4. Yahoo.speaker: Customer
4. Yahoo.korean: 아, 죄송합니다. 한국에서는 산에서 조용해야 하나요?
4. Yahoo.tts: 아, 죄송합니다. 한국에서는 산에서 조용해야 하나요?

4. Yahoo.english: Oh, sorry. In Korea, do you have to be quiet in the mountains?

4. Yahoo.speaker: Staff
4. Yahoo.korean: 네, 자연보호하고 다른 사람들도 있어서 크게 소리내지는 않아요.

4. Yahoo.speaker: Customer
4. Yahoo.english: Okay, I didn't know that. Thank you.

5. Makgealli.english: It's delicious. It's a little sweet.

5. Makgealli.korean: 많이 마시면 알딸딸해져요. 여기 오이도 하나 드세요.

5. Makgealli.roman: ma-ni ma-si-myeon al-ttal-ttal-hae-jyeo-yo. yeo-gi o-i-do ha-na deu-se-yo.
5. Makgealli.english: If you drink too much, you'll get tipsy. Here, have a cucumber too.

5. Makgealli.speaker: Customer
5. Makgealli.english: Yes, thank you. But what is altt ...

5. Makgealli.speaker: Staff
5. Makgealli.english: Oh, that means I'm a little tipsy.

1. Class Consultation.speaker: Staff
1. Class Consultation.english: Hello. What class are you looking for?

1. Class Consultation.speaker: Customer
1. Class Consultation.english: This is a Korean class. I'm a foreigner and this is my first time learning.

1. Class Consultation.speaker: Staff
1. Class Consultation.korean: 저희 외국인 전용 한국어 과정이 있어요. 레벨 테스트 먼저 보셔야 해요.

1. Class Consultation.roman: jeo-hui oe-gu-gin jeo-nyong han-gu-geo gwa-jeong-i i-sseo-yo. re-bel te-seu-teu meon-jeo bo-syeo-ya hae-yo.

1. Class Consultation.speaker: Staff
1. Class Consultation.korean: 네, 무료예요. 30분 정도 걸리고 바로 결과 나와요.
1. Class Consultation.tts: 네, 무료예요. 30분 정도 걸리고 바로 결과 나와요.
1. Class Consultation.roman: ne, mu-ryo-ye-yo. 30bun jeong-do geol-li-go ba-ro gyeol-gwa na-wa-yo.
1. Class Consultation.english: Yes, it's free. It takes about 30 minutes and you'll get results right away.

1. Class Consultation.speaker: Customer
1. Class Consultation.english: How is the class conducted? Do you explain it in English?

1. Class Consultation.speaker: Staff
1. Class Consultation.korean: 초급은 영어랑 한국어 섞어서 해요. 중급부터는 한국어로만 진행해요.
1. Class Consultation.tts: 초급은 영어랑 한국어 섞어서 해요. 중급부터는 한국어로만 진행해요.
1. Class Consultation.roman: cho-geu-beun yeong-eo-rang han-gu-geo seo-kkeo-seo hae-yo. jung-geup-ppu-teo-neun han-gu-geo-ro-man jin-haeng-hae-yo.
1. Class Consultation.english: Beginner level is taught in a mix of English and Korean. From intermediate level onwards, it is taught solely in Korean.

1. Class Consultation.speaker: Customer
1. Class Consultation.english: How many students are in your class?

1. Class Consultation.speaker: Staff
1. Class Consultation.korean: 보통 여덟명에서 열두명이에요. 너무 많으면 수업 질이 떨어져서 제한하고 있어요.

1. Class Consultation.roman: bo-tong yeo-deol-myeong-e-seo yeol-du-myeong-i-e-yo. neo-mu ma-neu-myeon su-eop ji-ri tteo-reo-jyeo-seo je-han-ha-go i-sseo-yo.
1. Class Consultation.english: Usually, there are eight to twelve students. If there are too many, the quality of the class deteriorates, so we limit the number.

1. Class Consultation.speaker: Customer
1. Class Consultation.english: Okay, I'll take the level test first.

10. Completion/Graduation.speaker: Customer

10. Completion/Graduation.speaker: Staff

2. Tuition/Registration.speaker: Customer

7. Class Change/Level Up.roman: geu-geot-tto ga-neung-hae-yo. cheo-eum han dal a-ne-neun re-bel jo-jeong ja-yu-rop-kke hal su i-sseo-yo.

2-1. Choosing Meat.roman: sam-gyeop-ssa-reun gi-reu-mi man-go go-so-hae-yo. mok-ssa-reun sal-ko-gi-ga ma-na-seo dam-bae-kae-yo.
2-1. Choosing Meat.english: Samgyeopsal is fatty and rich. Moksal has a lot of lean meat, so it's light.

2-1. Choosing Meat.tts: 며칠 동안 숙성시켜서 육질이 더 부드럽고 맛이 깊어요. 가격이 좀 더 나가요.
2-1. Choosing Meat.roman: myeo-chil dong-an suk-sseong-si-kyeo-seo yuk-jji-ri deo bu-deu-reop-kko ma-si gi-peo-yo. ga-gyeo-gi jom deo na-ga-yo.
2-1. Choosing Meat.english: It is aged for several days, so the meat is softer and has a deeper flavor. It is a bit more expensive.

2-1. Choosing Meat.speaker: Staff
2-1. Choosing Meat.english: It's 180 grams. Usually, one person eats two servings.

2-1. Choosing Meat.speaker: Staff
2-1. Choosing Meat.korean: 네, 차돌박이랑 꽃등심 있어요. 한우도 있는데 가격이 좀 비싸요.

2-1. Choosing Meat.roman: ne, cha-dol-ba-gi-rang kkot-tteung-sim i-sseo-yo. ha-nu-do in-neun-de ga-gyeo-gi jom bi-ssa-yo.
2-1. Choosing Meat.english: Yes, we have chadolbagi and flower sirloin. We also have Korean beef, but it's a bit expensive.

2-1. Choosing Meat.english: Please give me three servings of pork belly and two servings of pork neck.

2-1. Choosing Meat.speaker: Staff
2-1. Choosing Meat.english: Okay, I'll bring you some pork belly first.

2-2. Choosing Meat.speaker: Staff
2-2. Choosing Meat.korean: 오늘은 꽃등심과 안심이 좋아요. 꽃등심은 부드럽고, 안심은 담백해요.
2-2. Choosing Meat.tts: 오늘은 꽃등심과 안심이 좋아요. 꽃등심은 부드럽고, 안심은 담백해요.
2-2. Choosing Meat.roman: o-neu-reun kkot-tteung-sim-gwa an-si-mi jo-a-yo. kkot-tteung-si-meun bu-deu-reop-kko, an-si-meun dam-bae-kae-yo.
2-2. Choosing Meat.english: Today, I like sirloin and tenderloin. Sirloin is tender, and tenderloin is mild.

2-2. Choosing Meat.speaker: Customer
2-2. Choosing Meat.korean: 음... 꽃등심으로 할게요. 두명이면 어느정도 시켜야 돼요?
2-2. Choosing Meat.tts: 음... 꽃등심으로 할게요. 두명이면 어느정도 시켜야 돼요?
2-2. Choosing Meat.roman: eum... kkot-tteung-si-meu-ro hal-ge-yo. du-myeong-i-myeon eo-neu-jeong-do si-kyeo-ya dwae-yo?
2-2. Choosing Meat.english: Umm... I'll have the sirloin. How much should we order for two people?

2-2. Choosing Meat.speaker: Staff
2-2. Choosing Meat.korean: 두분이면 300그람정도가 적당해요. 드시고 모자라면 추가로 주문하시면 돼요.

2-2. Choosing Meat.roman: du-bu-ni-myeon 300geu-ram-jeong-do-ga jeok-ttang-hae-yo. deu-si-go mo-ja-ra-myeon chu-ga-ro ju-mun-ha-si-myeon dwae-yo.
2-2. Choosing Meat.english: For two people, about 300 grams is appropriate. If you eat and it's not enough, you can order more.

2-2. Choosing Meat.speaker: Customer

2-2. Choosing Meat.tts: 알겠습니다. 그럼 300그람 주세요. 된장찌게도 같이 주세요.
2-2. Choosing Meat.roman: al-get-sseum-ni-da. geu-reom 300geu-ram ju-se-yo. doen-jang-jji-ge-do ga-chi ju-se-yo.
2-2. Choosing Meat.english: Okay, then give me 300 grams. And some soybean paste stew, please.

2-2. Choosing Meat.english: We offer soybean paste stew as a service.

2-2. Choosing Meat.speaker: Customer
2-2. Choosing Meat.korean: 예, 일단 그렇게 주세요. 아, 물좀 갖다주세요.
2-2. Choosing Meat.tts: 예, 일단 그렇게 주세요. 아, 물좀 갖다주세요.
2-2. Choosing Meat.roman: ye, il-dan geu-reo-ke ju-se-yo. a, mul-jom gat-tta-ju-se-yo.
2-2. Choosing Meat.english: Yes, please give me that. Oh, and please bring me some water.

3-1. Grilling Method.speaker: Staff
3-1. Grilling Method.korean: 고기 구워드릴까요? 아니면 직접 하실 거예요?
3-1. Grilling Method.tts: 고기 구워드릴까요? 아니면 직접 하실 거예요?
3-1. Grilling Method.roman: go-gi gu-wo-deu-ril-kka-yo? a-ni-myeon jik-jjeop ha-sil geo-ye-yo?
3-1. Grilling Method.english: Would you like me to grill the meat for you, or would you rather do it yourself?

3-1. Grilling Method.speaker: Customer
3-1. Grilling Method.english: Yes, please bake it. I don't know how to do it because it's my first time.

3-1. Grilling Method.speaker: Staff
3-1. Grilling Method.korean: 먼저 불판이 뜨거워지면 고기를 올려요. 한쪽 면이 익으면 뒤집어요.
3-1. Grilling Method.tts: 먼저 불판이 뜨거워지면 고기를 올려요. 한쪽 면이 익으면 뒤집어요.
3-1. Grilling Method.roman: meon-jeo bul-pa-ni tteu-geo-wo-ji-myeon go-gi-reul ol-lyeo-yo. han-jjok myeo-ni i-geu-myeon dwi-ji-beo-yo.
3-1. Grilling Method.english: First, when the grill is hot, place the meat on it. Once one side is cooked, turn it over.

3-1. Grilling Method.speaker: Customer
3-1. Grilling Method.english: How long should I cook it?

3-1. Grilling Method.speaker: Staff
3-1. Grilling Method.korean: 겉이 갈색 나고 기름이 지글지글 나오면 다 익은 거예요.
3-1. Grilling Method.tts: 겉이 갈색 나고 기름이 지글지글 나오면 다 익은 거예요.
3-1. Grilling Method.roman: geo-chi gal-saek na-go gi-reu-mi ji-geul-ji-geul na-o-myeon da i-geun geo-ye-yo.
3-1. Grilling Method.english: It's done when the outside turns brown and oil starts sizzling.

3-1. Grilling Method.speaker: Customer
3-1. Grilling Method.korean: 불판 바꿔주실 수 있어요? 타고 있어요.
3-1. Grilling Method.tts: 불판 바꿔주실 수 있어요? 타고 있어요.
3-1. Grilling Method.roman: bul-pan ba-kkwo-ju-sil su i-sseo-yo? ta-go i-sseo-yo.
3-1. Grilling Method.english: Can you change the grill? It's burning.

3-1. Grilling Method.speaker: Staff
3-1. Grilling Method.korean: 네, 바로 새 불판 갖다드릴게요. 잠시만 기다려주세요.
3-1. Grilling Method.tts: 네, 바로 새 불판 갖다드릴게요. 잠시만 기다려주세요.
3-1. Grilling Method.roman: ne, ba-ro sae bul-pan gat-tta-deu-ril-ge-yo. jam-si-man gi-da-ryeo-ju-se-yo.
3-1. Grilling Method.english: Yes, I'll bring you a new grill right away. Please wait a moment.

3-1. Grilling Method.speaker: Customer
3-1. Grilling Method.english: Can I cut it with scissors?

3-1. Grilling Method.speaker: Staff
3-1. Grilling Method.korean: 네, 먹기 좋게 잘라드릴게요. 한입 크기가 먹기 편해요.
3-1. Grilling Method.tts: 네, 먹기 좋게 잘라드릴게요. 한입 크기가 먹기 편해요.
3-1. Grilling Method.roman: ne, meok-kki jo-ke jal-la-deu-ril-ge-yo. ha-nip keu-gi-ga meok-kki pyeon-hae-yo.
3-1. Grilling Method.english: Yes, I'll cut it into bite-sized pieces. It'll be easy to eat in bite sizes.

3-1. Grilling Method.speaker: Staff

3-1. Grilling Method.tts: 불 세기 조절할까요? 너무 세면 말씀해주세요.
3-1. Grilling Method.roman: bul se-gi jo-jeol-hal-kka-yo? neo-mu se-myeon mal-sseum-hae-ju-se-yo.
3-1. Grilling Method.english: Should I adjust the heat? If it's too strong, please let me know.

3-2. Grilling Method.speaker: Staff
3-2. Grilling Method.english: I'll cook it for you. Is this your first time eating pork belly?

3-2. Grilling Method.speaker: Customer
3-2. Grilling Method.english: Yes, thank you. It's not the first time.

3-2. Grilling Method.speaker: Staff
3-2. Grilling Method.korean: 삼겹살은 일단 한쪽면을 다 익히고, 지글지글 소리가 잦아들 즈음에 뒤집으면 돼요.
3-2. Grilling Method.tts: 삼겹살은 일단 한쪽면을 다 익히고, 지글지글 소리가 잦아들 즈음에 뒤집으면 돼요.
3-2. Grilling Method.roman: sam-gyeop-ssa-reun il-dan han-jjong-myeo-neul da i-ki-go, ji-geul-ji-geul so-ri-ga ja-ja-deul jeu-eu-me dwi-ji-beu-myeon dwae-yo.
3-2. Grilling Method.english: For the pork belly, cook one side first, and then flip it over when the sizzling sound subsides.

3-2. Grilling Method.speaker: Staff
3-2. Grilling Method.korean: 고기 굽는 소리예요. 한국에서는 지글지글이라고 해요.
3-2. Grilling Method.tts: 고기 굽는 소리예요. 한국에서는 지글지글이라고 해요.
3-2. Grilling Method.roman: go-gi gum-neun so-ri-ye-yo. han-gu-ge-seo-neun ji-geul-ji-geu-ri-ra-go hae-yo.
3-2. Grilling Method.english: It's the sound of meat grilling. In Korea, we call it sizzling.

3-2. Grilling Method.speaker: Staff
3-2. Grilling Method.korean: 뒤집어진 면에서 지글지글 소리가 잦아들 때 쯤 이렇게 집어서 가위로 먹기 좋게 자르면 돼요.
3-2. Grilling Method.tts: 뒤집어진 면에서 지글지글 소리가 잦아들 때 쯤 이렇게 집어서 가위로 먹기 좋게 자르면 돼요.
3-2. Grilling Method.roman: dwi-ji-beo-jin myeo-ne-seo ji-geul-ji-geul so-ri-ga ja-ja-deul ttae jjeum i-reo-ke ji-beo-seo ga-wi-ro meok-kki jo-ke ja-reu-myeon dwae-yo.
3-2. Grilling Method.english: When the sizzling sound on the flipped side subsides, pick it up like this and cut it with scissors into bite-sized pieces.

3-2. Grilling Method.speaker: Staff
3-2. Grilling Method.korean: 김치도 올려 드릴게요. 김치는 이쪽 기름이 빠지는 부분에 올려놓으시면 돼요.
3-2. Grilling Method.tts: 김치도 올려 드릴게요. 김치는 이쪽 기름이 빠지는 부분에 올려놓으시면 돼요.
3-2. Grilling Method.roman: gim-chi-do ol-lyeo deu-ril-ge-yo. gim-chi-neun i-jjok gi-reu-mi ppa-ji-neun bu-bu-ne ol-lyeo-no-eu-si-myeon dwae-yo.
3-2. Grilling Method.english: I'll put kimchi on top too. You can put the kimchi on this side where the oil drains.

3-2. Grilling Method.speaker: Staff
3-2. Grilling Method.korean: 자, 이제 고기가 적당히 익혀지면 드시면 돼요.
3-2. Grilling Method.tts: 자, 이제 고기가 적당히 익혀지면 드시면 돼요.
3-2. Grilling Method.roman: ja, i-je go-gi-ga jeok-ttang-hi i-kyeo-ji-myeon deu-si-myeon dwae-yo.
3-2. Grilling Method.english: Okay, now that the meat is cooked to your liking, you can eat it.

3-3. Grilling Method.speaker: Staff
3-3. Grilling Method.english: No, we'll bake it for you.

3-3. Grilling Method.tts: 감사합니다. 저희는 좀 미디엄으로 먹고 싶어요.
3-3. Grilling Method.roman: gam-sa-ham-ni-da. jeo-hui-neun jom mi-di-eo-meu-ro meok-kko si-peo-yo.
3-3. Grilling Method.english: Thank you. We would like to have it medium rare.

3-3. Grilling Method.speaker: Staff
3-3. Grilling Method.english: Yes, I understand. I'll cook it for you.

3-3. Grilling Method.speaker: Customer
3-3. Grilling Method.english: By any chance, where is the salt and sauce?

3-3. Grilling Method.speaker: Staff
3-3. Grilling Method.korean: 아, 갖다 드릴게요. 소금은 고기 본연의 맛을 살려주고, 소스는 약간 달콤한 맛이에요.
3-3. Grilling Method.tts: 아, 갖다 드릴게요. 소금은 고기 본연의 맛을 살려주고, 소스는 약간 달콤한 맛이에요.
3-3. Grilling Method.roman: a, gat-tta deu-ril-ge-yo. so-geu-meun go-gi bo-nyeo-nui ma-seul sal-lyeo-ju-go, so-seu-neun yak-kkan dal-kom-han ma-si-e-yo.
3-3. Grilling Method.english: Oh, I'll bring it to you. The salt brings out the meat's natural flavor, and the sauce is slightly sweet.

4. How to Eat.speaker: Staff
4. How to Eat.korean: 상추에 고기 올리고 쌈장이랑 마늘 넣고 싸서 드세요.
4. How to Eat.tts: 상추에 고기 올리고 쌈장이랑 마늘 넣고 싸서 드세요.
4. How to Eat.roman: sang-chu-e go-gi ol-li-go ssam-jang-i-rang ma-neul neo-ko ssa-seo deu-se-yo.
4. How to Eat.english: Put the meat on lettuce, add ssamjang and garlic, wrap it up and eat.

4. How to Eat.english: It's a sauce made by mixing soybean paste and red pepper paste. It's sweet and salty.

4. How to Eat.speaker: Staff
4. How to Eat.korean: 참기름에 소금 섞은 거예요. 삼겹살 찍어 먹으면 고소해요.
4. How to Eat.tts: 참기름에 소금 섞은 거예요. 삼겹살 찍어 먹으면 고소해요.
4. How to Eat.roman: cham-gi-reu-me so-geum seo-kkeun geo-ye-yo. sam-gyeop-ssal jji-geo meo-geu-myeon go-so-hae-yo.
4. How to Eat.english: It's sesame oil mixed with salt. It's delicious when you dip pork belly in it.

4. How to Eat.speaker: Customer
4. How to Eat.english: Do you eat the pickled radish together?

4. How to Eat.speaker: Staff
4. How to Eat.korean: 네, 고기 위에 올려서 같이 싸 드세요. 느끼함을 잡아줘요.
4. How to Eat.tts: 네, 고기 위에 올려서 같이 싸 드세요. 느끼함을 잡아줘요.
4. How to Eat.roman: ne, go-gi wi-e ol-lyeo-seo ga-chi ssa deu-se-yo. neu-kki-ha-meul ja-ba-jwo-yo.
4. How to Eat.english: Yes, put it on top of the meat and eat it together. It helps cut down on the greasiness.

4. How to Eat.speaker: Staff
4. How to Eat.korean: 네, 불판 가장자리에 놓으면 달콤하게 익어요. 생으로 드셔도 되고요.
4. How to Eat.tts: 네, 불판 가장자리에 놓으면 달콤하게 익어요. 생으로 드셔도 되고요.
4. How to Eat.roman: ne, bul-pan ga-jang-ja-ri-e no-eu-myeon dal-kom-ha-ge i-geo-yo. saeng-eu-ro deu-syeo-do doe-go-yo.
4. How to Eat.english: Yes, if you place it on the edge of the grill, it will cook sweetly. You can also eat it raw.

3-2. Waiting/Boarding.speaker: Traveler

3-2. Waiting/Boarding.speaker: Citizen
3-2. Waiting/Boarding.korean: 아, 카드는... 타실 때 단말기에 갖다 대시면 돼요. 그러면 "삑"소리가 날거예요. 그러면 된 거예요.

3-2. Waiting/Boarding.english: Ah, for the card... just hold it up to the terminal when you ride. You'll hear a "beep" sound. That's it.

3-2. Waiting/Boarding.roman: ma-ja-yo. byeol-lo eo-ryeop-jji a-na-yo. a, nae-ri-sil ttae-do dan-mal-gi-e ka-deu-reul dae-eo-ya hae-yo. geu-rae-ya ga-sin geo-ri-man-keum do-ni kka-jyeo-yo.
3-2. Waiting/Boarding.english: That's right. It's not that difficult. Oh, and you still have to tap your card on the terminal when you get off. That way, they'll charge you the amount equivalent to the distance you traveled.

3-2. Waiting/Boarding.english: Oh, that means money is being taken out of your balance.

3-2. Waiting/Boarding.speaker: Traveler
3-2. Waiting/Boarding.english: What happens if I don't wear it when I get off?

3-2. Waiting/Boarding.speaker: Citizen

7. Facilities.english: Yes, anyone can sit.

9. Elderly/Disabled.speaker: Citizen

9. Elderly/Disabled.english: Please use the low-floor bus. The driver will lower you down the ramp.

9. Elderly/Disabled.speaker: Citizen

10. Complaints/Issues.english: The bus stop is so dirty. It hasn't been cleaned.

1. Civil Affairs Info.speaker: Visitor

1-1. Reservation/Check-in.speaker: Staff
1-1. Reservation/Check-in.english: Thank you. Please wait in the waiting room. I will call your name.

1-2. Reservation/Check-in.speaker: Patient

1-2. Reservation/Check-in.english: Oh, yes. You called yesterday because of a wisdom toothache...

2. Describing Symptoms.speaker: Patient
2. Describing Symptoms.english: My upper right wisdom tooth hurts.

2. Describing Symptoms.speaker: Dentist
2. Describing Symptoms.english: Since when have you been sick?

2. Describing Symptoms.english: It's been like this for three days. It hurts worse when I eat something cold.

2. Describing Symptoms.speaker: Dentist
2. Describing Symptoms.english: Let me take a look. I'll take an X-ray first.

2. Describing Symptoms.speaker: Dentist
2. Describing Symptoms.korean: 충치가 좀 깊어요. 신경 치료가 필요할 수 있어요.

2. Describing Symptoms.roman: chung-chi-ga jom gi-peo-yo. sin-gyeong chi-ryo-ga pi-ryo-hal su i-sseo-yo.
2. Describing Symptoms.english: The cavity is quite deep. It may require root canal treatment.

2. Describing Symptoms.speaker: Patient
2. Describing Symptoms.english: Does root canal treatment hurt a lot?

2. Describing Symptoms.speaker: Dentist
2. Describing Symptoms.korean: 마취하니까 치료할 때는 안 아파요. 걱정 마세요.
2. Describing Symptoms.tts: 마취하니까 치료할 때는 안 아파요. 걱정 마세요.
2. Describing Symptoms.roman: ma-chwi-ha-ni-kka chi-ryo-hal ttae-neun an a-pa-yo. geok-jjeong ma-se-yo.
2. Describing Symptoms.english: It won't hurt during the treatment because you'll be anesthetized. Don't worry.

2. Describing Symptoms.speaker: Patient
2. Describing Symptoms.english: Yes, I understand. Please treat it.

3. Scaling.speaker: Patient
3. Scaling.english: Hello. I came to get scaling done.

3. Scaling.tts: 네 어서 오세요. 마지막으로 언제 받으셨어요?

3. Scaling.roman: chi-seo-gi jom in-ne-yo. 20bun jeong-do geol-lil geo-ye-yo.
3. Scaling.english: There's some tartar. It'll take about 20 minutes.

3. Scaling.speaker: Dentist
3. Scaling.english: Yes, it is covered once a year.

3. Scaling.speaker: Dentist
3. Scaling.korean: 보험 적용되면 만 오천 원 정도예요.
3. Scaling.tts: 보험 적용되면 만 오천 원 정도예요.
3. Scaling.roman: bo-heom jeo-gyong-doe-myeon man o-cheon won jeong-do-ye-yo.
3. Scaling.english: If insurance is applied, it's about 50,000 won.

3. Scaling.speaker: Patient
3. Scaling.english: Can I tell you if it hurts?

3. Scaling.speaker: Dentist
3. Scaling.english: Of course. If you raise your hand, I'll stop right away.

4. Cavity Treatment.speaker: Dentist
4. Cavity Treatment.english: I have a cavity and need treatment.

4. Cavity Treatment.speaker: Dentist
4. Cavity Treatment.korean: 아직 초기라서 떼우면 돼요. 신경까진 안 갔어요.
4. Cavity Treatment.tts: 아직 초기라서 떼우면 돼요. 신경까진 안 갔어요.

4. Cavity Treatment.english: What material is it made of?

4. Cavity Treatment.speaker: Dentist

4. Cavity Treatment.speaker: Patient
4. Cavity Treatment.english: Is there a big price difference?

4. Cavity Treatment.speaker: Dentist
4. Cavity Treatment.english: Resin costs 30,000 won and gold costs about 150,000 won.

4. Cavity Treatment.speaker: Dentist
4. Cavity Treatment.korean: 네 마취 먼저 할게요. 좀 따끔할 수 있어요.
4. Cavity Treatment.tts: 네 마취 먼저 할게요. 좀 따끔할 수 있어요.
4. Cavity Treatment.roman: ne ma-chwi meon-jeo hal-ge-yo. jom tta-kkeum-hal su i-sseo-yo.
4. Cavity Treatment.english: Yes, I'll administer anesthesia first. It might sting a little.

4. Cavity Treatment.speaker: Dentist
4. Cavity Treatment.korean: 다 됐어요. 30분 동안은 음식 드시지 마세요.
4. Cavity Treatment.tts: 다 됐어요. 30분 동안은 음식 드시지 마세요.
4. Cavity Treatment.roman: da dwae-sseo-yo. 30bun dong-a-neun eum-sik deu-si-ji ma-se-yo.

5-1. Extraction.speaker: Dentist

5-1. Extraction.speaker: Dentist
5-1. Extraction.korean: 마취해서 뽑을 때는 안 아파요. 마취 풀리면 조금 아플 수 있고요.
5-1. Extraction.tts: 마취해서 뽑을 때는 안 아파요. 마취 풀리면 조금 아플 수 있고요.

5-1. Extraction.speaker: Dentist
5-1. Extraction.english: Yes, I'll give you a prescription. I'll give you a three-day supply.

5-1. Extraction.english: What are the precautions after extraction?

5-2. Extraction.speaker: Dentist

5-2. Extraction.speaker: Patient

5-2. Extraction.english: Shall we take a look? Oh, try it.

5-2. Extraction.english: Should I get my wisdom teeth pulled?

5-2. Extraction.speaker: Dentist

5-2. Extraction.tts: 여기 보이시죠? 사랑니가 어금니를 옆으로 밀고 있어요. 뽑는 게 낫겠어요.

5-2. Extraction.english: See here? My wisdom tooth is pushing my molar to the side. I think it's better to pull it out.

5-2. Extraction.speaker: Dentist
5-2. Extraction.english: I'll anesthetize you and pull it out for you after you wait a moment.

8. Whitening.english: Please make it something that works quickly.

1. Check-in.speaker: Patient

10. Night/Emergency Info.speaker: Visitor

10. Night/Emergency Info.speaker: Staff
10. Night/Emergency Info.english: The emergency room is open 24 hours a day. Follow me.

10. Night/Emergency Info.english: Do you get extra pay at night?

10. Night/Emergency Info.speaker: Staff

10. Night/Emergency Info.tts: 네 밤 열시 이후에는 야간 가산이 적용돼요.

10. Night/Emergency Info.english: Yes, after 10 PM, a night surcharge applies.

10. Night/Emergency Info.english: If it's not an emergency, you won't see me?

10. Night/Emergency Info.speaker: Staff

10. Night/Emergency Info.speaker: Staff
10. Night/Emergency Info.english: 119 ambulances are free. Private ambulances are paid.

10. Night/Emergency Info.speaker: Visitor
10. Night/Emergency Info.korean: 응급은 아닌데 진료를 받으려면 어떻게 해요?
10. Night/Emergency Info.tts: 응급은 아닌데 진료를 받으려면 어떻게 해요?

10. Night/Emergency Info.english: How do I get medical care if it's not an emergency?

10. Night/Emergency Info.speaker: Staff

10. Night/Emergency Info.tts: 내일 아침에 외래로 예약하시는 게 더 좋을 것 같아요.
10. Night/Emergency Info.roman: nae-il a-chi-me oe-rae-ro ye-ya-ka-si-neun ge deo jo-eul geot ga-ta-yo.
10. Night/Emergency Info.english: I think it would be better to make an appointment for an outpatient visit tomorrow morning.

2. Symptoms.speaker: Doctor
2. Symptoms.english: Since when have you been sick?

2. Symptoms.speaker: Patient
2. Symptoms.english: About an hour or two ago.

2. Symptoms.korean: 다른 증상도 있으세요? 열이나 구토 같은 거요.
2. Symptoms.tts: 다른 증상도 있으세요? 열이나 구토 같은 거요.
2. Symptoms.roman: da-reun jeung-sang-do i-sseu-se-yo? yeo-ri-na gu-to ga-teun geo-yo.
2. Symptoms.english: Do you have any other symptoms? Like fever or vomiting.

2. Symptoms.english: I feel nauseous. I think I'm going to throw up.

2. Symptoms.speaker: Patient
2. Symptoms.english: Yes, I have a penicillin allergy.

2. Symptoms.speaker: Doctor
2. Symptoms.english: Are you currently taking any medication?

2. Symptoms.speaker: Patient
2. Symptoms.english: I take blood pressure medication every day.

2. Symptoms.speaker: Doctor
2. Symptoms.english: Okay, I'll do a blood test and a CT scan.

3. Tests/Treatment.speaker: Patient
3. Tests/Treatment.english: How did you get out? Are you okay?

3. Tests/Treatment.speaker: Doctor
3. Tests/Treatment.english: I have appendicitis. I need surgery.

3. Tests/Treatment.speaker: Patient
3. Tests/Treatment.korean: 수술을 꼭 해야 해요? 약으로는 안 돼요?
3. Tests/Treatment.tts: 수술을 꼭 해야 해요? 약으로는 안 돼요?
3. Tests/Treatment.roman: su-su-reul kkok hae-ya hae-yo? ya-geu-ro-neun an dwae-yo?
3. Tests/Treatment.english: Do I really need surgery? Can't medication do it?

3. Tests/Treatment.speaker: Doctor
3. Tests/Treatment.korean: 네 터지기 전에 빨리 해야 해요.
3. Tests/Treatment.tts: 네 터지기 전에 빨리 해야 해요.
3. Tests/Treatment.roman: ne teo-ji-gi jeo-ne ppal-li hae-ya hae-yo.
3. Tests/Treatment.english: Yes, we need to do it quickly before it explodes.

3. Tests/Treatment.speaker: Doctor
3. Tests/Treatment.korean: 일반적인 수술이라서 걱정 안 하셔도 돼요. 한시간 정도면 끝나요.
3. Tests/Treatment.tts: 일반적인 수술이라서 걱정 안 하셔도 돼요. 한시간 정도면 끝나요.
3. Tests/Treatment.roman: il-ban-jeo-gin su-su-ri-ra-seo geok-jjeong an ha-syeo-do dwae-yo. han-si-gan jeong-do-myeon kkeun-na-yo.
3. Tests/Treatment.english: It's a common surgery, so don't worry. It'll be over in about an hour.

3. Tests/Treatment.speaker: Doctor
3. Tests/Treatment.korean: 전신 마취로 진행해요. 잠들었다 깨어나면 끝나 있을 거예요.
3. Tests/Treatment.tts: 전신 마취로 진행해요. 잠들었다 깨어나면 끝나 있을 거예요.
3. Tests/Treatment.roman: jeon-sin ma-chwi-ro jin-haeng-hae-yo. jam-deu-reot-tta kkae-eo-na-myeon kkeun-na i-sseul geo-ye-yo.
3. Tests/Treatment.english: It's done under general anesthesia. You'll fall asleep and wake up to find it's done.

3. Tests/Treatment.speaker: Patient
3. Tests/Treatment.english: How many days will I need to stay in the hospital?

4. Surgery Consent.speaker: Doctor
4. Surgery Consent.english: You must fill out a consent form before surgery.

4. Surgery Consent.speaker: Doctor
4. Surgery Consent.korean: 출혈이나 감염 가능성이 있지만 매우 드물어요.
4. Surgery Consent.tts: 출혈이나 감염 가능성이 있지만 매우 드물어요.
4. Surgery Consent.roman: chul-hyeo-ri-na ga-myeom ga-neung-seong-i it-jji-man mae-u deu-mu-reo-yo.
4. Surgery Consent.english: There is a possibility of bleeding or infection, but this is very rare.

4. Surgery Consent.speaker: Guardian
4. Surgery Consent.english: How much does the surgery cost roughly?

4. Surgery Consent.speaker: Staff
4. Surgery Consent.english: If insurance is applied, it will cost around 500,000 won.

4. Surgery Consent.speaker: Staff
4. Surgery Consent.korean: 수술실 앞에 대기실이 있어요. 거기서 기다려주세요.
4. Surgery Consent.tts: 수술실 앞에 대기실이 있어요. 거기서 기다려주세요.
4. Surgery Consent.roman: su-sul-sil a-pe dae-gi-si-ri i-sseo-yo. geo-gi-seo gi-da-ryeo-ju-se-yo.
4. Surgery Consent.english: There is a waiting room in front of the operating room. Please wait there.

4. Surgery Consent.speaker: Guardian
4. Surgery Consent.english: Could you please contact me after the surgery?

4. Surgery Consent.speaker: Staff
4. Surgery Consent.english: Yes, then please leave your contact information.

5. Trauma/Fracture.speaker: Patient
5. Trauma/Fracture.english: I fell and my arm hurts so much.

5. Trauma/Fracture.speaker: Doctor
5. Trauma/Fracture.english: Where does it hurt the most?

5. Trauma/Fracture.speaker: Patient
5. Trauma/Fracture.english: My wrist. I can't move it.

5. Trauma/Fracture.speaker: Doctor
5. Trauma/Fracture.english: Okay, I'll take an X-ray first.

5. Trauma/Fracture.speaker: Doctor
5. Trauma/Fracture.korean: 아니요 깁스로 고정하면 돼요. 수술까지는 필요 없어요.
5. Trauma/Fracture.tts: 아니요 깁스로 고정하면 돼요. 수술까지는 필요 없어요.
5. Trauma/Fracture.roman: a-ni-yo gip-sseu-ro go-jeong-ha-myeon dwae-yo. su-sul-kka-ji-neun pi-ryo eop-seo-yo.
5. Trauma/Fracture.english: No, just fix it with a cast. You don't need surgery.

5. Trauma/Fracture.speaker: Patient
5. Trauma/Fracture.english: How long does a cast need to last?

5. Trauma/Fracture.speaker: Doctor
5. Trauma/Fracture.english: About 4 to 6 weeks. Don't overdo it during that time.

6. Fever/Infection.speaker: Patient
6. Fever/Infection.english: My fever has risen to 39 degrees. My whole body hurts.

6. Fever/Infection.speaker: Doctor
6. Fever/Infection.english: Do you also have a cough or runny nose?

6. Fever/Infection.speaker: Patient
6. Fever/Infection.english: My throat hurts a lot. It's hard to swallow.

6. Fever/Infection.speaker: Doctor
6. Fever/Infection.english: Let me check your neck. Oh, try it.

6. Fever/Infection.speaker: Doctor
6. Fever/Infection.korean: 네 편도가 많이 부었어요. 수액을 맞으셔야 해요.
6. Fever/Infection.tts: 네 편도가 많이 부었어요. 수액을 맞으셔야 해요.
6. Fever/Infection.roman: ne pyeon-do-ga ma-ni bu-eo-sseo-yo. su-ae-geul ma-jeu-syeo-ya hae-yo.
6. Fever/Infection.english: Your tonsils are very swollen. You need to get IV fluids.

6. Fever/Infection.speaker: Patient
6. Fever/Infection.english: Do I need to take antibiotics too?

6. Fever/Infection.speaker: Doctor
6. Fever/Infection.korean: 네 처방해드릴게요. 3일치 드릴 테니까 꼭 다 드세요.
6. Fever/Infection.tts: 네 처방해드릴게요. 3일치 드릴 테니까 꼭 다 드세요.
6. Fever/Infection.roman: ne cheo-bang-hae-deu-ril-ge-yo. 3il-chi deu-ril te-ni-kka kkok da deu-se-yo.
6. Fever/Infection.english: Yes, I'll prescribe it for you. I'll give you a three-day supply, so be sure to take it all.

6. Fever/Infection.speaker: Patient
6. Fever/Infection.english: Do I need to be hospitalized?

6. Fever/Infection.speaker: Doctor
6. Fever/Infection.korean: 수액 맞고 열이 내리면 귀가하셔도 돼요.
6. Fever/Infection.tts: 수액 맞고 열이 내리면 귀가하셔도 돼요.
6. Fever/Infection.roman: su-aek mat-kko yeo-ri nae-ri-myeon gwi-ga-ha-syeo-do dwae-yo.
6. Fever/Infection.english: Once you get the IV and your fever goes down, you can go home.

7. IV/Treatment.speaker: Nurse
7. IV/Treatment.english: I'll give you an IV. Give me your arm.

7. IV/Treatment.speaker: Patient
7. IV/Treatment.english: Are you in a lot of pain?

7. IV/Treatment.speaker: Nurse
7. IV/Treatment.english: It stings a little. Please bear with it for a moment.

7. IV/Treatment.english: How much sap should I take?

1. Fire Report.korean: 알겠습니다. 지금 바로 출동합니다. 안전한 곳에서 기다리세요.
1. Fire Report.tts: 알겠습니다. 지금 바로 출동합니다. 안전한 곳에서 기다리세요.
1. Fire Report.roman: al-get-sseum-ni-da. ji-geum ba-ro chul-dong-ham-ni-da. an-jeon-han go-se-seo gi-da-ri-se-yo.
1. Fire Report.english: Understood. We're dispatching immediately. Please wait in a safe place.

1. Fire Report.speaker: Staff
1. Fire Report.korean: 5분 안에 도착합니다. 절대 다시 건물 안으로 들어가지 마세요.
1. Fire Report.tts: 5분 안에 도착합니다. 절대 다시 건물 안으로 들어가지 마세요.
1. Fire Report.roman: 5bun a-ne do-cha-kam-ni-da. jeol-dae da-si geon-mul a-neu-ro deu-reo-ga-ji ma-se-yo.
1. Fire Report.english: We'll be there in 5 minutes. Never go back into the building again.

2. Ambulance.speaker: Caller
2. Ambulance.english: My eyes are open, but I can't speak.

2. Ambulance.speaker: Caller
2. Ambulance.english: Yes, I am holding my breath.

2. Ambulance.speaker: Staff
2. Ambulance.korean: 좋아요. 움직이지 마시고 옆으로 눕혀주세요. 토할 수 있어요.
2. Ambulance.tts: 좋아요. 움직이지 마시고 옆으로 눕혀주세요. 토할 수 있어요.
2. Ambulance.roman: jo-a-yo. um-ji-gi-ji ma-si-go yeo-peu-ro nu-pyeo-ju-se-yo. to-hal su i-sseo-yo.
2. Ambulance.english: Okay. Please don't move and lay on your side. You might vomit.

2. Ambulance.speaker: Staff
2. Ambulance.korean: 구급대가 가서 확인할게요. 정확한 주소 알려주세요.
2. Ambulance.tts: 구급대가 가서 확인할게요. 정확한 주소 알려주세요.
2. Ambulance.roman: gu-geup-ttae-ga ga-seo hwa-gin-hal-ge-yo. jeong-hwa-kan ju-so al-lyeo-ju-se-yo.
2. Ambulance.english: An ambulance will go and check on you. Please give me the exact address.

2. Ambulance.speaker: Staff
2. Ambulance.korean: 알겠습니다. 3분 안에 도착할게요. 전화 끊지 마세요.
2. Ambulance.tts: 알겠습니다. 3분 안에 도착할게요. 전화 끊지 마세요.
2. Ambulance.roman: al-get-sseum-ni-da. 3bun a-ne do-cha-kal-ge-yo. jeon-hwa kkeun-ji ma-se-yo.
2. Ambulance.english: Okay, I'll be there in three minutes. Don't hang up.

3. Rescue.speaker: Caller
3. Rescue.english: I'm stuck in the elevator! Help!

3. Rescue.speaker: Staff
3. Rescue.korean: 침착하세요. 건물 주소랑 몇 층인지 알려주세요.
3. Rescue.tts: 침착하세요. 건물 주소랑 몇 층인지 알려주세요.
3. Rescue.roman: chim-cha-ka-se-yo. geon-mul ju-so-rang myeot cheung-in-ji al-lyeo-ju-se-yo.
3. Rescue.english: Calm down. Please tell me the building address and what floor it is on.

3. Rescue.speaker: Caller
3. Rescue.english: It stopped between the 7th and 8th floors. It's Teheran-ro in Gangnam-gu.

3. Rescue.speaker: Staff
3. Rescue.english: Are you alone? Are you hurt?

3. Rescue.speaker: Caller
3. Rescue.korean: 네 혼자예요. 다친 건 없는데 너무 무서워요.
3. Rescue.tts: 네 혼자예요. 다친 건 없는데 너무 무서워요.
3. Rescue.roman: ne hon-ja-ye-yo. da-chin geon eom-neun-de neo-mu mu-seo-wo-yo.
3. Rescue.english: Yes, I'm alone. I'm not hurt, but I'm so scared.

3. Rescue.speaker: Staff
3. Rescue.korean: 괜찮아요. 구조대를 바로 보낼게요. 침착하게 기다려주세요.
3. Rescue.tts: 괜찮아요. 구조대를 바로 보낼게요. 침착하게 기다려주세요.
3. Rescue.roman: gwaen-cha-na-yo. gu-jo-dae-reul ba-ro bo-nael-ge-yo. chim-cha-ka-ge gi-da-ryeo-ju-se-yo.
3. Rescue.english: It's okay. I'll send a rescue team right away. Please wait calmly.

3. Rescue.speaker: Caller
3. Rescue.english: Won't there be a shortage of air?

3. Rescue.speaker: Staff
3. Rescue.korean: 걱정 마세요. 환기가 되니까 공기는 괜찮아요. 버튼은 계속 누르지 마세요.
3. Rescue.tts: 걱정 마세요. 환기가 되니까 공기는 괜찮아요. 버튼은 계속 누르지 마세요.
3. Rescue.roman: geok-jjeong ma-se-yo. hwan-gi-ga doe-ni-kka gong-gi-neun gwaen-cha-na-yo. beo-teu-neun gye-sok nu-reu-ji ma-se-yo.
3. Rescue.english: Don't worry. The air is fine, as it's ventilated. Just don't keep pressing the button.

3. Rescue.speaker: Caller
3. Rescue.english: How long do I have to wait?

3. Rescue.speaker: Staff
3. Rescue.english: I'll rescue you in 10 minutes. Please bear with me for a moment.

4. Fire Safety.speaker: Visitor
4. Fire Safety.korean: 안녕하세요. 소방 안전 교육을 신청하러 왔어요.
4. Fire Safety.tts: 안녕하세요. 소방 안전 교육을 신청하러 왔어요.
4. Fire Safety.roman: an-nyeong-ha-se-yo. so-bang an-jeon gyo-yu-geul sin-cheong-ha-reo wa-sseo-yo.
4. Fire Safety.english: Hello. I'm here to apply for fire safety training.

4. Fire Safety.speaker: Staff
4. Fire Safety.korean: 네 안녕하세요. 단체 신청이세요 아니면 개인이세요?
4. Fire Safety.tts: 네 안녕하세요. 단체 신청이세요 아니면 개인이세요?
4. Fire Safety.roman: ne an-nyeong-ha-se-yo. dan-che sin-cheong-i-se-yo a-ni-myeon gae-i-ni-se-yo?
4. Fire Safety.english: Yes, hello. Are you applying as a group or as an individual?

4. Fire Safety.speaker: Visitor
4. Fire Safety.english: I'm applying as a company group. There are about 30 people.

4. Fire Safety.speaker: Staff
4. Fire Safety.english: Yes, do you have a preferred date?

4. Fire Safety.speaker: Visitor
4. Fire Safety.english: Okay. What is the content of the training?

4. Fire Safety.speaker: Staff
4. Fire Safety.korean: 소화기 사용법이랑 대피 훈련을 해요. 실습도 포함이에요.
4. Fire Safety.tts: 소화기 사용법이랑 대피 훈련을 해요. 실습도 포함이에요.
4. Fire Safety.roman: so-hwa-gi sa-yong-beo-bi-rang dae-pi hul-lyeo-neul hae-yo. sil-seup-tto po-ha-mi-e-yo.
4. Fire Safety.english: We teach fire extinguisher use and evacuation drills, including practical training.

4. Fire Safety.speaker: Staff
4. Fire Safety.english: It's free. Just fill out the application form.

5. Extinguisher Check.speaker: Visitor
5. Extinguisher Check.english: Hello. I'm here to get my fire extinguisher checked.

5. Extinguisher Check.speaker: Staff
5. Extinguisher Check.english: Yes, hello. Did you bring a fire extinguisher?

5. Extinguisher Check.speaker: Visitor
5. Extinguisher Check.english: Yes, here it is. Is it expired?

5. Extinguisher Check.speaker: Staff
5. Extinguisher Check.korean: 네 새 걸로 바꾸셔야 해요. 충전도 안 되는 상태예요.
5. Extinguisher Check.tts: 네 새 걸로 바꾸셔야 해요. 충전도 안 되는 상태예요.
5. Extinguisher Check.roman: ne sae geol-lo ba-kku-syeo-ya hae-yo. chung-jeon-do an doe-neun sang-tae-ye-yo.
5. Extinguisher Check.english: Yes, you need to replace it with a new one. It won't even charge.

5. Extinguisher Check.speaker: Visitor
5. Extinguisher Check.english: Where can I buy a fire extinguisher?

5. Extinguisher Check.speaker: Staff
5. Extinguisher Check.english: You can buy it at a fire supply store or online.

5. Extinguisher Check.speaker: Visitor
5. Extinguisher Check.english: How much does it usually cost?

5. Extinguisher Check.speaker: Staff
5. Extinguisher Check.english: It costs about 30,000 won for 3.3 kg.

6. Fire Prevention.speaker: Visitor
6. Fire Prevention.korean: 안녕하세요. 화재 예방 점검을 신청하려고 왔어요.
6. Fire Prevention.tts: 안녕하세요. 화재 예방 점검을 신청하려고 왔어요.
6. Fire Prevention.roman: an-nyeong-ha-se-yo. hwa-jae ye-bang jeom-geo-meul sin-cheong-ha-ryeo-go wa-sseo-yo.
6. Fire Prevention.english: Hello. I'm here to request a fire prevention inspection.

6. Fire Prevention.speaker: Staff
6. Fire Prevention.english: Yes, hello. Is it residential or commercial?

6. Fire Prevention.speaker: Visitor
6. Fire Prevention.english: It's a restaurant. It's about to open.

6. Fire Prevention.speaker: Staff
6. Fire Prevention.english: In that case, you will need a certificate of completion of fire safety facilities.

6. Fire Prevention.speaker: Visitor
6. Fire Prevention.korean: 네 맞아요. 영업 신고할 때 필요하다고 해서요.
6. Fire Prevention.tts: 네 맞아요. 영업 신고할 때 필요하다고 해서요.
6. Fire Prevention.roman: ne ma-ja-yo. yeong-eop sin-go-hal ttae pi-ryo-ha-da-go hae-seo-yo.
6. Fire Prevention.english: Yes, that's right. They said it was needed when reporting business.

6. Fire Prevention.speaker: Staff
6. Fire Prevention.english: We will issue it after an on-site inspection.

6. Fire Prevention.speaker: Staff
6. Fire Prevention.english: We will visit you within 3 days after you apply.

6. Fire Prevention.speaker: Staff
6. Fire Prevention.english: No, it's free. Please fill out the application form.

7. Report/Inquiry.speaker: Caller
7. Report/Inquiry.korean: 불법 주정차 때문에 소방차가 우리 건물에 못 들어와요.
7. Report/Inquiry.tts: 불법 주정차 때문에 소방차가 우리 건물에 못 들어와요.
7. Report/Inquiry.roman: bul-beop ju-jeong-cha ttae-mu-ne so-bang-cha-ga u-ri geon-mu-re mot deu-reo-wa-yo.
7. Report/Inquiry.english: Fire trucks can't enter our building because of illegal parking.

7. Report/Inquiry.speaker: Caller
7. Report/Inquiry.korean: 저희 아파트 정문 앞이에요. 항상 막혀 있어요.
7. Report/Inquiry.tts: 저희 아파트 정문 앞이에요. 항상 막혀 있어요.
7. Report/Inquiry.roman: jeo-hui a-pa-teu jeong-mun a-pi-e-yo. hang-sang ma-kyeo i-sseo-yo.
7. Report/Inquiry.english: It's in front of the main entrance of our apartment. It's always blocked.

7. Report/Inquiry.speaker: Staff
7. Report/Inquiry.korean: 불법 주정차는 경찰에 신고하시면 돼요. 112로 전화해주세요.
7. Report/Inquiry.tts: 불법 주정차는 경찰에 신고하시면 돼요. 112로 전화해주세요.
7. Report/Inquiry.roman: bul-beop ju-jeong-cha-neun gyeong-cha-re sin-go-ha-si-myeon dwae-yo. 112ro jeon-hwa-hae-ju-se-yo.
7. Report/Inquiry.english: You can report illegal parking to the police. Call 112.

7. Report/Inquiry.speaker: Caller
7. Report/Inquiry.korean: 소방차 전용 구역 표시를 해주실 수 있어요?
7. Report/Inquiry.tts: 소방차 전용 구역 표시를 해주실 수 있어요?
7. Report/Inquiry.roman: so-bang-cha jeo-nyong gu-yeok pyo-si-reul hae-ju-sil su i-sseo-yo?
7. Report/Inquiry.english: Could you please mark the fire truck only area?

7. Report/Inquiry.speaker: Staff
7. Report/Inquiry.english: You need to request that from your local district office.

7. Report/Inquiry.speaker: Caller
7. Report/Inquiry.english: And is it possible to tour the fire station?

7. Report/Inquiry.speaker: Staff
7. Report/Inquiry.english: Yes, you can apply as a group.

7. Report/Inquiry.speaker: Caller
7. Report/Inquiry.english: Can I come from daycare too?

7. Report/Inquiry.speaker: Staff
7. Report/Inquiry.korean: 네 많이 오세요. 소방차 체험도 할 수 있어요.
7. Report/Inquiry.tts: 네 많이 오세요. 소방차 체험도 할 수 있어요.
7. Report/Inquiry.roman: ne ma-ni o-se-yo. so-bang-cha che-heom-do hal su i-sseo-yo.
7. Report/Inquiry.english: Yes, please come. You can also experience driving a fire truck.

8. First Aid.speaker: Caller
8. First Aid.english: It's cardiac arrest! What should I do?!

8. First Aid.speaker: Staff
8. First Aid.korean: 침착하세요. 지금 바로 가슴 압박을 시작하세요.
8. First Aid.tts: 침착하세요. 지금 바로 가슴 압박을 시작하세요.
8. First Aid.roman: chim-cha-ka-se-yo. ji-geum ba-ro ga-seum ap-ppa-geul si-ja-ka-se-yo.
8. First Aid.english: Stay calm. Begin chest compressions right now.

8. First Aid.speaker: Caller
8. First Aid.english: How do I do it? I've never done it before.

8. First Aid.speaker: Staff
8. First Aid.korean: 양손 깍지 끼고 가슴 한가운데를 세게 눌러요. 팔을 펴고요.
8. First Aid.tts: 양손 깍지 끼고 가슴 한가운데를 세게 눌러요. 팔을 펴고요.
8. First Aid.roman: yang-son kkak-jji kki-go ga-seum han-ga-un-de-reul se-ge nul-leo-yo. pa-reul pyeo-go-yo.
8. First Aid.english: Clasp your hands together and press firmly against the center of your chest. Extend your arms.

8. First Aid.speaker: Staff
8. First Aid.english: About 100 to 120 times per minute. Never stop.

8. First Aid.speaker: Staff
8. First Aid.korean: 좋아요. 전원 켜시고 음성 안내 따라서 하세요.
8. First Aid.tts: 좋아요. 전원 켜시고 음성 안내 따라서 하세요.
8. First Aid.roman: jo-a-yo. jeo-nwon kyeo-si-go eum-seong an-nae tta-ra-seo ha-se-yo.
8. First Aid.english: Okay. Turn it on and follow the voice instructions.

8. First Aid.speaker: Staff
8. First Aid.korean: 2분 안에 도착해요. 계속 압박하세요. 잘 하고 계세요.
8. First Aid.tts: 2분 안에 도착해요. 계속 압박하세요. 잘 하고 계세요.
8. First Aid.roman: 2bun a-ne do-cha-kae-yo. gye-sok ap-ppa-ka-se-yo. jal ha-go gye-se-yo.
8. First Aid.english: I'll be there in two minutes. Keep pressing. You're doing great.

9. Gas Leak.speaker: Caller
9. Gas Leak.english: There's a strong smell of gas in my house!

9. Gas Leak.speaker: Staff
9. Gas Leak.english: First, open the window and go outside.

9. Gas Leak.speaker: Caller
9. Gas Leak.english: Should I turn off the gas valve?

9. Gas Leak.speaker: Staff
9. Gas Leak.korean: 안전하게 잠글 수 있으면 잠그세요. 하지만 전기 스위치는 절대 만지지 마세요.
9. Gas Leak.tts: 안전하게 잠글 수 있으면 잠그세요. 하지만 전기 스위치는 절대 만지지 마세요.
9. Gas Leak.roman: an-jeon-ha-ge jam-geul su i-sseu-myeon jam-geu-se-yo. ha-ji-man jeon-gi seu-wi-chi-neun jeol-dae man-ji-ji ma-se-yo.
9. Gas Leak.english: If you can safely lock it, lock it, but never touch the electrical switches.

9. Gas Leak.speaker: Caller
9. Gas Leak.english: Why? Can't you turn off the lights?

9. Gas Leak.speaker: Staff
9. Gas Leak.korean: 불꽃이 튀면 가스가 폭발할 수 있어요. 위험해요.
9. Gas Leak.tts: 불꽃이 튀면 가스가 폭발할 수 있어요. 위험해요.
9. Gas Leak.roman: bul-kko-chi twi-myeon ga-seu-ga pok-ppal-hal su i-sseo-yo. wi-heom-hae-yo.
9. Gas Leak.english: If a spark is caught, the gas can explode. It's dangerous.

9. Gas Leak.speaker: Caller
9. Gas Leak.english: Should I tell my neighbors too?

9. Gas Leak.speaker: Staff
9. Gas Leak.english: Please evacuate your neighbors as well.

9. Gas Leak.speaker: Caller
9. Gas Leak.english: Should I also contact the city gas company?

9. Gas Leak.speaker: Staff
9. Gas Leak.english: We'll contact you. Just give us your exact address.

1. Membership.speaker: Customer
1. Membership.english: Hello. I'm here to sign up for a gym membership.

1. Membership.speaker: Staff
1. Membership.english: Yes, nice to meet you. What kind of pass are you looking for?

1. Membership.speaker: Customer
1. Membership.english: What types of tickets are available?

1. Membership.speaker: Staff
1. Membership.korean: 한개월, 3개월, 12개월 이용권이 있어요. 기간이 길수록 할인이 커요.
1. Membership.tts: 한개월, 삼개월, 일이개월 이용권이 있어요. 기간이 길수록 할인이 커요.
1. Membership.roman: han-gae-wol, sam-gae-wol, i-ri-gae-wol i-yong-gwo-ni i-sseo-yo. gi-ga-ni gil-su-rok ha-ri-ni keo-yo.
1. Membership.english: We offer one-month, three-month, and twelve-month passes. The longer the period, the greater the discount.

1. Membership.speaker: Staff
1. Membership.tts: 월 6만원이에요. 총 72만원인데 지금 가입하시면 이개월 무료예요.
1. Membership.roman: wol 6ma-nwo-ni-e-yo. chong 72ma-nwo-nin-de ji-geum ga-i-pa-si-myeon i-gae-wol mu-ryo-ye-yo.
1. Membership.english: It's 60,000 won per month. That's a total of 720,000 won, but if you sign up now, you get two months free.

1. Membership.speaker: Staff
1. Membership.korean: PT는 별도 등록이에요. 관심 있으시면 PT 상담도 해드릴게요.
1. Membership.tts: PT는 별도 등록이에요. 관심 있으시면 PT 상담도 해드릴게요.
1. Membership.roman: PTneun byeol-do deung-no-gi-e-yo. gwan-sim i-sseu-si-myeon PT sang-dam-do hae-deu-ril-ge-yo.
1. Membership.english: PT is a separate registration. If you're interested, I'll also provide PT consultation.

1. Membership.speaker: Customer
1. Membership.english: Can I use the swimming pool too?

1. Membership.speaker: Staff
1. Membership.korean: 네 종합권으로 가입하시면 수영장 사우나 모두 이용 가능해요.
1. Membership.tts: 네 종합권으로 가입하시면 수영장 사우나 모두 이용 가능해요.
1. Membership.roman: ne jong-hap-kkwo-neu-ro ga-i-pa-si-myeon su-yeong-jang sa-u-na mo-du i-yong ga-neung-hae-yo.
1. Membership.english: Yes, if you sign up for a comprehensive ticket, you can use the swimming pool and sauna.

2. Facilities.speaker: Customer
2. Facilities.english: Can I tour the facilities before signing up?

2. Facilities.speaker: Staff
2. Facilities.english: Okay, I'll show you around. Come this way.

2. Facilities.speaker: Customer
2. Facilities.korean: 운동 기구가 많네. 몇 대나 있어요?
2. Facilities.tts: 운동 기구가 많네. 몇 대나 있어요?
2. Facilities.roman: un-dong gi-gu-ga man-ne. myeot dae-na i-sseo-yo?
2. Facilities.english: There's a lot of exercise equipment. How many are there?

2. Facilities.speaker: Staff
2. Facilities.korean: 유산소 머신 50대 근력 운동 기구 100대 이상 있어요.
2. Facilities.tts: 유산소 머신 쉰대 근력 운동 기구 100대 이상 있어요.
2. Facilities.roman: yu-san-so meo-sin swin-dae geul-lyeok un-dong gi-gu 100dae i-sang i-sseo-yo.
2. Facilities.english: We have over 50 aerobic machines and 100 strength training machines.

2. Facilities.speaker: Customer
2. Facilities.english: Is there a free weights area?

10. Membership.speaker: Staff
10. Membership.korean: 일단,...., 주말 회원권 같은 경우는 5천만원 정도하구요. 주말,주중 회원권인 경우는 1억 넘을 거예요.

10. Membership.speaker: Staff

11. Hole information.speaker: Player
11. Hole information.english: Is this hole a Papo hole?

11. Hole information.speaker: Caddie
11. Hole information.korean: 좌도그랙 홀이라서 그린이 안보여요. 저 앞에 벙커 우측으로 치시면 돼요.
11. Hole information.tts: 좌도그랙 홀이라서 그린이 안보여요. 저 앞에 벙커 우측으로 치시면 돼요.
11. Hole information.roman: jwa-do-geu-raek ho-ri-ra-seo geu-ri-ni an-bo-yeo-yo. jeo a-pe beong-keo u-cheu-geu-ro chi-si-myeon dwae-yo.
11. Hole information.english: It's a dogleg hole, so you can't see the green. Just hit to the right of the bunker in front.

11. Hole information.speaker: Player
11. Hole information.english: How much is left once you get there?

11. Hole information.speaker: Caddie
11. Hole information.korean: 거기까지 가는데 220미터이고, 저기서 그린까지는 한 130미터 남을 거예요.
11. Hole information.tts: 거기까지 가는데 220미터이고, 저기서 그린까지는 한 130미터 남을 거예요.

11. Hole information.english: It's 220 meters to get there, and from there it's about 130 meters to the green.

12-1. Approach.speaker: Caddie
12-1. Approach.korean: 그린 주변에서 어프로치는 보통 어떤 채를 사용하세요?
12-1. Approach.tts: 그린 주변에서 어프로치는 보통 어떤 채를 사용하세요?

12-1. Approach.english: What club do you usually use for your approach around the green?

12-1. Approach.speaker: Player
12-1. Approach.english: Within 50 meters, S and P are usually used.

12-1. Approach.speaker: Caddie
12-1. Approach.english: Okay, how far does a 7 iron go?

12-2. Approach.speaker: Caddie
12-2. Approach.english: There's about 120 meters left. Just a moment. Let me measure it. It's 121 meters.

12-2. Approach.speaker: Caddie
12-2. Approach.korean: 그린 왼쪽이 약간 높으니까 그쪽을 보고 치시면 흘러 내려올 거예요.

12-2. Approach.english: The green on the left is a little higher, so if you aim at that side and hit, it will roll down.

12-3. Approach.speaker: Player
12-3. Approach.english: Wouldn't it be better to roll it?

12-3. Approach.speaker: Caddie
12-3. Approach.korean: 네, 오르막 라이니까 평소보다 조금 더 보셔도 돼요.
12-3. Approach.tts: 네, 오르막 라이니까 평소보다 조금 더 보셔도 돼요.
12-3. Approach.roman: ne, o-reu-mak ra-i-ni-kka pyeong-so-bo-da jo-geum deo bo-syeo-do dwae-yo.
12-3. Approach.english: Yes, it's an uphill climb, so you can see a little more than usual.

12-3. Approach.speaker: Player
12-3. Approach.english: Is the left side higher? Is the right side higher?

12-3. Approach.speaker: Caddie
12-3. Approach.korean: 왼쪽이 조금 높아요. 그린이 오늘은 좀 느려요. 2.8정도 돼요. 그거 감안하세요.
12-3. Approach.tts: 왼쪽이 조금 높아요. 그린이 오늘은 좀 느려요. 2.8정도 돼요. 그거 감안하세요.
12-3. Approach.roman: oen-jjo-gi jo-geum no-pa-yo. geu-ri-ni o-neu-reun jom neu-ryeo-yo. 2.8jeong-do dwae-yo. geu-geo ga-man-ha-se-yo.
12-3. Approach.english: The left side is a little high. The green is a little slow today. It's about 2.8. Please take that into account.

13. OB.speaker: Caddie
13. OB.english: The left is Obigo, and the right is Hazard.

13. OB.speaker: Caddie
13. OB.korean: 예, 있습니다. 오비티, 헤저드티 다 있습니다.

13. OB.english: Just look slightly to the right of the bunker in front.

14. Putting.speaker: Player
14. Putting.english: The hole is too far. I'll do a three-putt.

14. Putting.speaker: Caddie
14. Putting.english: I looked slightly to the left. I saw about a cup.

14. Putting.speaker: Caddie
14. Putting.english: Yes, it's more like a rai than it looks.

14. Putting.speaker: Player
14. Putting.korean: 아, 그렇네요. 제가 치는 순간에 약간 오른 쪽으로 밀려서 그렇지, 라이데로만 쳤으면 들어갔을 것 같아요.
14. Putting.tts: 아, 그렇네요. 제가 치는 순간에 약간 오른 쪽으로 밀려서 그렇지, 라이데로만 쳤으면 들어갔을 것 같아요.

14. Putting.english: Oh, that's right. It was pushed a little to the right when I hit it, but if I had hit it with a rider, it would have gone in.

15. Wind.speaker: Player
15. Wind.english: It's very windy. Is it a headwind?

15. Wind.speaker: Caddie
15. Wind.korean: 옆바람, 맞바람이 같이 있는 것 같아요.
15. Wind.tts: 옆바람, 맞바람이 같이 있는 것 같아요.
15. Wind.roman: yeop-ppa-ram, mat-ppa-ra-mi ga-chi in-neun geot ga-ta-yo.
15. Wind.english: It seems like there is a crosswind and a headwind at the same time.

15. Wind.speaker: Player
15. Wind.korean: 그럼 한클럽 길게 잡아야 겠네요. 홀까지 몇미터예요?
15. Wind.tts: 그럼 한클럽 길게 잡아야 겠네요. 홀까지 몇미터예요?
15. Wind.roman: geu-reom han-keul-leop gil-ge ja-ba-ya gen-ne-yo. hol-kka-ji myeon-mi-teo-ye-yo?
15. Wind.english: Then I guess I'll have to take a longer club. How many meters is it to the hole?

15. Wind.speaker: Caddie
15. Wind.korean: 그린 뒷편은 헤저드예요. 조금 짧은 게 나을 수도 있어요.
15. Wind.tts: 그린 뒷편은 헤저드예요. 조금 짧은 게 나을 수도 있어요.
15. Wind.roman: geu-rin dwit-pyeo-neun he-jeo-deu-ye-yo. jo-geum jjal-beun ge na-eul su-do i-sseo-yo.
15. Wind.english: The back of the green is a hazard. A slightly shorter one might be better.

15. Wind.speaker: Player
15. Wind.english: Really? I can't see it here.

15. Wind.speaker: Caddie
15. Wind.english: If you go there, you'll find it.

15. Wind.speaker: Caddie
15. Wind.english: Green Parisi is 3.1. It's a little fast.

15. Wind.speaker: Player
15. Wind.korean: 그럼, 4번 우드로 주세요. 조금 짧으면 어프로치 해서 붙이죠. 뭐.
15. Wind.tts: 그럼, 4번 우드로 주세요. 조금 짧으면 어프로치 해서 붙이죠. 뭐.
15. Wind.roman: geu-reom, 4beon u-deu-ro ju-se-yo. jo-geum jjal-beu-myeon eo-peu-ro-chi hae-seo bu-chi-jyo. mwo.
15. Wind.english: Okay, give me a 4-wood. If it's a little short, I'll just hit it on the approach. Yeah.

12. Han River Cruise Ticketing.english: Even a live performance! It's so cool. I heard you can even feed seagulls on board. Is that true?

12. Han River Cruise Ticketing.speaker: Staff
12. Han River Cruise Ticketing.korean: 네, 매점에서 갈매기 먹이를 팔고 있어요. 배 갑판 위로 올라가시면 갈매기들이 많이 모여들 거예요.
12. Han River Cruise Ticketing.tts: 네, 매점에서 갈매기 먹이를 팔고 있어요. 배 갑판 위로 올라가시면 갈매기들이 많이 모여들 거예요.

12. Han River Cruise Ticketing.english: Yes, we sell seagull food at the concession stand. If you go up to the deck, you'll see a lot of seagulls.

13. Tent Zone Confirmation.tts: 여기 잔디밭에 개인 텐트를 쳐도 되나요? 한국 분들이 많이들 치고 계시네요.

13. Tent Zone Confirmation.speaker: Staff
13. Tent Zone Confirmation.korean: 텐트 설치 가능 구역이 정해져 있어요. 그리고 밤 일곱시 이후에는 모두 철거하셔야 하고 텐트 문을 두 면 이상 열어두셔야 합니다.
13. Tent Zone Confirmation.tts: 텐트 설치 가능 구역이 정해져 있어요. 그리고 밤 일곱시 이후에는 모두 철거하셔야 하고 텐트 문을 두 면 이상 열어두셔야 합니다.

13. Tent Zone Confirmation.english: There are designated areas where tents can be pitched. Also, all tents must be taken down after 7 p.m., and at least two tent doors must be open.

13. Tent Zone Confirmation.speaker: Traveler
13. Tent Zone Confirmation.korean: 아, 문을 열어둬야 하는 규칙이 있군요! 몰랐으면 실수할 뻔했네요. 설치 가능 구역은 어디서 확인하나요?

13. Tent Zone Confirmation.english: Oh, there's a rule that says you have to keep the door open! I almost made a mistake if I didn't know. Where can I check the installation area?

13. Tent Zone Confirmation.speaker: Staff
13. Tent Zone Confirmation.korean: 저기 바닥에 초록색 선이 그려진 안쪽은 다 가능해요. 선 밖으로 나가시면 안 되니 주의해 주세요.

13. Tent Zone Confirmation.english: Anything inside the green line drawn on the floor is allowed. Please be careful not to go outside the line.

13. Tent Zone Confirmation.speaker: Traveler
13. Tent Zone Confirmation.korean: 네, 알겠습니다. 그늘진 곳에 자리를 잡아야겠어요. 캠핑 의자만 사용하는 건 구역 상관없나요?

13. Tent Zone Confirmation.english: Yes, I understand. I'll need to find a spot in the shade. Is it okay if I just use a camping chair?

1-2. inquiry.speaker: Staff

3. Inquiry.speaker: Customer
3. Inquiry.korean: 일본의 회랑 조금 다른 것 같네요.
3. Inquiry.tts: 일본의 회랑 조금 다른 것 같네요.
3. Inquiry.roman: il-bo-nui hoe-rang jo-geum da-reun geot gan-ne-yo.
3. Inquiry.english: It seems a little different from the Japanese hall.

3. Inquiry.speaker: Staff
3. Inquiry.korean: 다르죠. 일본은 옛날부터 숙회를 먹었어요. 반면에 한국은 활어회를 먹었고요.
3. Inquiry.tts: 다르죠. 일본은 옛날부터 숙회를 먹었어요. 반면에 한국은 활어회를 먹었고요.
3. Inquiry.roman: da-reu-jyo. il-bo-neun yen-nal-bu-teo su-koe-reul meo-geo-sseo-yo. ban-myeo-ne han-gu-geun hwa-reo-hoe-reul meo-geot-kko-yo.
3. Inquiry.english: It's different. Japan has been eating boiled fish since ancient times. On the other hand, Korea has been eating raw fish.

3. Inquiry.speaker: Staff
3. Inquiry.korean: 숙회는 약간 숙성시킨 거예요. 물고기를 잡아서 바로 먹는 게 아니고, 하루정도 보관했다가 먹는 거예요.
3. Inquiry.tts: 숙회는 약간 숙성시킨 거예요. 물고기를 잡아서 바로 먹는 게 아니고, 하루정도 보관했다가 먹는 거예요.
3. Inquiry.roman: su-koe-neun yak-kkan suk-sseong-si-kin geo-ye-yo. mul-go-gi-reul ja-ba-seo ba-ro meong-neun ge a-ni-go, ha-ru-jeong-do bo-gwan-haet-tta-ga meong-neun geo-ye-yo.
3. Inquiry.english: Sukhoe is slightly aged fish. It is not eaten right after catching the fish, but rather stored for about a day before eating.

3. Inquiry.speaker: Staff
3. Inquiry.korean: 활어회는 살아 있는 것을 바로 회를 뜨는 거예요. 훨씬 싱싱하죠.
3. Inquiry.tts: 활어회는 살아 있는 것을 바로 회를 뜨는 거예요. 훨씬 싱싱하죠.
3. Inquiry.roman: hwa-reo-hoe-neun sa-ra in-neun geo-seul ba-ro hoe-reul tteu-neun geo-ye-yo. hwol-ssin sing-sing-ha-jyo.
3. Inquiry.english: Live sashimi is made from live fish. It's much fresher.

3. Inquiry.speaker: Customer
3. Inquiry.english: Why is there such a difference?

3. Inquiry.speaker: Staff
3. Inquiry.korean: 일본은 전통적으로 육식은 하지 않았잖아요? 그래서 내륙에서도 생선회를 먹어야 했기에 그런 것 같아요.
3. Inquiry.tts: 일본은 전통적으로 육식은 하지 않았잖아요? 그래서 내륙에서도 생선회를 먹어야 했기에 그런 것 같아요.
3. Inquiry.roman: il-bo-neun jeon-tong-jeo-geu-ro yuk-ssi-geun ha-ji a-nat-jja-na-yo? geu-rae-seo nae-ryu-ge-seo-do saeng-seon-hoe-reul meo-geo-ya haet-kki-e geu-reon geot ga-ta-yo.
3. Inquiry.english: Japan didn't traditionally eat meat, right? So I think that's why they had to eat raw fish even inland.

3. Inquiry.speaker: Customer
3. Inquiry.korean: 한은 옛날부터 내륙에서는 육식을 했고, 회는 해안가에서나 먹었죠. 그러니, 굳이 하루이틀 보관할 필요가 없었고요.
3. Inquiry.tts: 한은 옛날부터 내륙에서는 육식을 했고, 회는 해안가에서나 먹었죠. 그러니, 굳이 하루이틀 보관할 필요가 없었고요.
3. Inquiry.roman: ha-neun yen-nal-bu-teo nae-ryu-ge-seo-neun yuk-ssi-geul haet-kko, hoe-neun hae-an-ga-e-seo-na meo-geot-jjyo. geu-reo-ni, gu-ji ha-ru-i-teul bo-gwan-hal pi-ryo-ga eop-seot-kko-yo.
3. Inquiry.english: Since ancient times, Koreans have eaten meat inland, and raw fish was only eaten along the coast. Therefore, there was no need to store it for a day or two.

3. Inquiry.speaker: Staff
3. Inquiry.korean: 아, 그런 차이가 있을 수 있겠네요.
3. Inquiry.tts: 아, 그런 차이가 있을 수 있겠네요.
3. Inquiry.roman: a, geu-reon cha-i-ga i-sseul su it-kken-ne-yo.
3. Inquiry.english: Oh, I guess there could be a difference like that.

3. Inquiry.speaker: Staff
3. Inquiry.english: If you want to do business, you need to know at least this much, right? Haha

4. King Crab Purchase and Plating Fee.tts: 기본 차림비는 인당 4천 원 정도고, 킹크랩 찜 비용은 킬로당 조금씩 추가돼요. 그래도 일반 식당보다 훨씬 저렴하죠.

4. King Crab Purchase and Plating Fee.speaker: Traveler

4. King Crab Purchase and Plating Fee.speaker: Staff

6. Public Transportation.english: Is it easy to catch a taxi?

6. Public Transportation.english: During peak season, there are long lines. It's faster to call a taxi using Kakao Taxi or a call taxi app.

6. Public Transportation.speaker: Customer
6. Public Transportation.korean: 다음 코스로 섭지코지 갈 건데, 어느 쪽으로 가면 돼요?
6. Public Transportation.tts: 다음 코스로 섭지코지 갈 건데, 어느 쪽으로 가면 돼요?

6. Public Transportation.english: I'm going to Seopjikoji for the next course. Which way should I go?

6. Public Transportation.speaker: Staff
6. Public Transportation.korean: 차로 15분거리예요. 택시타면 금방가요. 버스도 있지만 환승 필요할 수 있어요.
6. Public Transportation.tts: 차로 15분거리예요. 택시타면 금방가요. 버스도 있지만 환승 필요할 수 있어요.
6. Public Transportation.roman: cha-ro 15bun-geo-ri-ye-yo. taek-ssi-ta-myeon geum-bang-ga-yo. beo-seu-do it-jji-man hwan-seung pi-ryo-hal su i-sseo-yo.
6. Public Transportation.english: It's a 15-minute drive. A taxi will get you there in no time. There's also a bus, but you might need to transfer.

6. Public Transportation.speaker: Customer
6. Public Transportation.english: Can I pay for taxi fare with a card?

6. Public Transportation.speaker: Staff
6. Public Transportation.korean: 네, 교통카드 찍으면 돼요. 현금도 돼요.
6. Public Transportation.tts: 네, 교통카드 찍으면 돼요. 현금도 돼요.
6. Public Transportation.roman: ne, gyo-tong-ka-deu jji-geu-myeon dwae-yo. hyeon-geum-do dwae-yo.
6. Public Transportation.english: Yes, you can use your transportation card. Cash is also accepted.

1. Entry.speaker: Customer

1. Entry.speaker: Staff

1. Entry.tts: 정상까지 올라가 볼려고요. 대략 얼마나 걸리나요?

1. Entry.english: I'm planning to climb to the top. How long will it take?

1. Entry.english: Yes, there is a barcode on the receipt, so you can scan it at the gate.

1. Entry.speaker: Customer

1. Entry.tts: 고맙습니다. 물은 안에 가서도 살 수 있죠?

1. Entry.english: Thank you. Can I still live in the water?

2-1. Inquiry.speaker: Customer
2-1. Inquiry.korean: 올라가는 길이 많이 힘든가요? 계단이 많아 보이던데요.
2-1. Inquiry.tts: 올라가는 길이 많이 힘든가요? 계단이 많아 보이던데요.

2-1. Inquiry.english: Is the climb difficult? It looks like there are a lot of stairs.

2-1. Inquiry.speaker: Staff
2-1. Inquiry.korean: 초반에 계단이 좀 있고, 중간부터는 완만해요. 천천히 가시면 됩니다.
2-1. Inquiry.tts: 초반에 계단이 좀 있고, 중간부터는 완만해요. 천천히 가시면 됩니다.

2-1. Inquiry.english: There are some stairs at the beginning, but it becomes gentle from the middle. Just take your time.

2-1. Inquiry.speaker: Customer
2-1. Inquiry.english: Is there a place to rest in the middle?

2-1. Inquiry.speaker: Staff
2-1. Inquiry.korean: 중턱 전망대에 벤치 몇 개 있어요. 거기서 바다 보면서 쉬면 좋아요.

2-1. Inquiry.roman: jung-teok jeon-mang-dae-e ben-chi myeot gae i-sseo-yo. geo-gi-seo ba-da bo-myeon-seo swi-myeon jo-a-yo.
2-1. Inquiry.english: There are a few benches at the mid-slope observatory. It's a nice place to rest and look out at the sea.

2-1. Inquiry.speaker: Customer
2-1. Inquiry.english: It'll be slippery if it rains, right?

2-1. Inquiry.speaker: Staff
2-1. Inquiry.korean: 맞아요. 비온 뒤엔 돌계단이 좀 미끄러워요. 오늘은 건조해서 괜찮아요.
2-1. Inquiry.tts: 맞아요. 비온 뒤엔 돌계단이 좀 미끄러워요. 오늘은 건조해서 괜찮아요.
2-1. Inquiry.roman: ma-ja-yo. bi-on dwi-en dol-gye-da-ni jom mi-kkeu-reo-wo-yo. o-neu-reun geon-jo-hae-seo gwaen-cha-na-yo.
2-1. Inquiry.english: That's right. The stone steps are a bit slippery after it rains. It's dry today, so it's fine.

2-1. Inquiry.speaker: Customer
2-1. Inquiry.english: Are the sports screens enough? Maybe not enough tracking shoes?

2-1. Inquiry.speaker: Staff
2-1. Inquiry.korean: 네, 밑창만 미끄럽지 않으면 운동화로도 충분해요.
2-1. Inquiry.tts: 네, 밑창만 미끄럽지 않으면 운동화로도 충분해요.
2-1. Inquiry.roman: ne, mit-chang-man mi-kkeu-reop-jji a-neu-myeon un-dong-hwa-ro-do chung-bun-hae-yo.
2-1. Inquiry.english: Yes, sneakers are fine as long as the soles aren't slippery.

2-1. Inquiry.speaker: Staff

2-1. Inquiry.english: Just bring water and a windbreaker. It's quite windy at the top.

2-2. Inquiry.tts: 내일 일출 보려면 몇 시쯤 오면 돼요?

2-2. Inquiry.english: What time should I arrive tomorrow to see the sunrise?

2-2. Inquiry.english: It's best to arrive 30 minutes before sunrise. The parking lot fills up early.

2-2. Inquiry.speaker: Customer
2-2. Inquiry.english: Do you also sell tickets at dawn?

2-2. Inquiry.speaker: Staff
2-2. Inquiry.korean: 네, 일출시간대엔 매표소 열어요. 사람 많으니 조금 서두르세요.

2-2. Inquiry.roman: ne, il-chul-si-gan-dae-en mae-pyo-so yeo-reo-yo. sa-ram ma-neu-ni jo-geum seo-du-reu-se-yo.

2-2. Inquiry.speaker: Customer
2-2. Inquiry.english: Is it very windy at the top?

2-2. Inquiry.speaker: Staff
2-2. Inquiry.korean: 네, 특히 겨울엔 체감온도가 낮아요. 장갑이랑 모자 챙기면 좋아요.

2-2. Inquiry.english: Yes, especially in winter, the temperature can feel cold. It's a good idea to bring gloves and a hat.

2-2. Inquiry.speaker: Customer
2-2. Inquiry.korean: 네, 알겠습니다. 주차장은 어디로 들어가면 되죠?
2-2. Inquiry.tts: 네, 알겠습니다. 주차장은 어디로 들어가면 되죠?
2-2. Inquiry.roman: ne, al-get-sseum-ni-da. ju-cha-jang-eun eo-di-ro deu-reo-ga-myeon doe-jyo?
2-2. Inquiry.english: Yes, I understand. Where do I enter the parking lot?

2-2. Inquiry.speaker: Staff
2-2. Inquiry.korean: 네비에 성산일출봉 공영주차장 찍고 오시면 바로 앞이에요.

2-2. Inquiry.english: If you enter Seongsan Ilchulbong Public Parking Lot on your navigation, it will be right in front of you.

3. Photo.tts: 감사합니다. 연속으로 몇 장만 더 부탁드려도 될까요?

3. Photo.english: Thank you. Could you please send me a few more in a row?

3. Photo.speaker: Staff

3. Photo.speaker: Customer
3. Photo.english: Thank you so much. Thanks to you, I got the shot of a lifetime.

4. Climate.speaker: Customer
4. Climate.korean: 오늘 시야는 어떤가요? 정상에서 잘 보일까요?
4. Climate.tts: 오늘 시야는 어떤가요? 정상에서 잘 보일까요?
4. Climate.roman: o-neul si-ya-neun eo-tteon-ga-yo? jeong-sang-e-seo jal bo-il-kka-yo?

4. Climate.speaker: Staff

4. Climate.speaker: Customer
4. Climate.korean: 바람이 어느정도 불어요? 모자가 날아갈 정도인가요?
4. Climate.tts: 바람이 어느정도 불어요? 모자가 날아갈 정도인가요?

4. Climate.speaker: Staff
4. Climate.korean: 난간없는 가장자리만 조심하시면 돼요. 셀카 찍을 때 뒤로 물러나지 마시고요.
4. Climate.tts: 난간없는 가장자리만 조심하시면 돼요. 셀카 찍을 때 뒤로 물러나지 마시고요.

4. Climate.speaker: Customer

4. Climate.speaker: Staff
4. Climate.korean: 안내 표지판에 관리사무소 번호가 있어요. 급하면 그냥 119누르세요.
